description: From Latin dērelictiō (“neglect, abandonment”), from dērelinquō (“I neglect, abandon”), from dē- + re- + linquō (“I leave”).

examples: The new soldier did not clean his cabin and was scolded for dereliction and disobedience.
What he did was a terrible dereliction of duty.

entries.meaning: The act of abandoning something, or the state of being abandoned.
examples: To this we must contend with prayer , with actual dereliction and seposition of all our other affairs

entries.meaning: Land gained from the water by a change of water-line.
